Description: Primary Key - Use this field to join to the other tbl_Data_SEM_OPA_* tables.
Derivation_Methodology: A unique integer assigned to the record in sequential order.  Does not represent any information about the patient.
Business check: Is it appropiate that we include the SQL? Why do we have one asterick instead of three?
RK 2: No SQL code, just a table name. Grammatical reasons.

Description: An identifier assigned during loading to aid processing.
Derivation_Methodology: An identifier assigned in sequential order to each load file during processing.  Does not represent any information about the patient.

Description: An identifier on the raw data which is imported used during loading and processing.
An identifier to distinguish between the OPA files during the load process.
Derivation_Methodology: Taken directly from the imported SEM OPA (Outpatient appointments) table.

Description: The DSCRO responsible for submitting the data.  Largely used for data processing rather than analysis.
Derivation_Methodology: Taken directly from the imported file to identify the DSCRO from which the data was received.
RK 2: Disagree, lets analysts know there are probably better fields to use.

Description: Indicates whether the appointment contains any Patient Confidential Data in free text fields. Any PCD is removed from the text fields and replaced with a marker within the string, e.g. if an NHS Number is found this is replaced with the text "_<NHS_No>_".
Derivation_Methodology: Prior to pseudonymisation and publication, eight free text fields (Unique_CDS_Identifier, Unique_Booking_Reference_Number_Converted, Local_Patient_ID, Patient_Pathway_ID, Provider_Reference_Number, Commissioner_Reference_Number, Agreement_Line_Number, Attendance_Identifier) are scanned for NHS Number, Postcode and Date of Birth of the patient.  If PCD is found in any of these fields,  the patient confidential data held within that field is stripped and replaced with a marker ('_<NHS_No>_', _<PC_' or '_<DoB_') and the record is flagged with a '1' in OPA_PCD_Indicator.
Business check: Is it nesscary to list all these? Doesn't make any sense in the second paragraph
RK 2:
For transparency of derivation methodology, I think so.
Reworded.

Description: An identifier applied by NHS Digital to each record prior to importing to the NCDR.
Details the reasons why the record is on the extract.
Business check: Does this need to be in the derived methodlologyt?

Description: CDS TYPE CODE is a code to identify the specific type of Commissioning Data Set data.
CDS PROTOCOL IDENTIFIER CODE is a code to identify the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol associated with the transaction.
A Commissioning Data Set data element providing a unique identity for the life-time of an episode carried in a Commissioning Data Set message.
An identifier assigned by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.
CDS UPDATE TYPE is a code to indicate the required database update process for the submitted CDS Message.
CDS BULK REPLACEMENT GROUP CODE is the Commissioning Data Set Group into which CDS Types must be grouped when using the Commissioning Data Set Bulk Replacement Update Mechanism.
CDS INTERCHANGE TEST INDICATOR indicates whether the Interchange is a production or test Interchange.
The date and time of the update event (or the nearest equivalent) that resulted in the need to exchange this CDS.
Data Dictionary Name:
CDS APPLICABLE DATE
CDS APPLICABLE TIME
Business check: Does this need to be put as derived?
RK 2: no, received from nhs digital in this format.

Description: CDS CENSUS DATE is the DATE on which the relevant census was undertaken.
CDS EXTRACT DATE is the DATE and TIME of the update event (or the nearest equivalent) that resulted in the need to exchange this Commissioning Data Set.
Data Dictionary Name:
CDS EXTRACT DATE
CDS EXTRACT TIME

Description: CDS REPORT PERIOD START DATE defines the Start Date (for the date range of the data being exchanged) for the Bulk Replacement Update time period.
CDS REPORT PERIOD END DATE defines the End Date (for the date range of the data being exchanged) for the Commissioning Data Set Bulk Replacement Update time period.
ORGANISATION CODE (CODE OF SUBMITTING ORGANISATION) is the ORGANISATION CODE of the Organisation acting as the physical sender of a Data Set submission.
The ORGANISATION CODE TYPE of the ORGANISATION acting as the physical sender of a Data Set submission.
Date the file was submitted.

CDS INTERCHANGE SENDER IDENTITY is the assigned EDI ("Electronic Data Interchange", a standard way of formatting data for exchange between organisations) Address of the physical Organisation or site responsible for sending Commissioning data.
Number used to identify a PATIENT uniquely within a Health Care Provider. It may be different from the PATIENT's casenote number and may be assigned automatically by the computer system.
ORGANISATION CODE (LOCAL PATIENT IDENTIFIER) is the ORGANISATION CODE of the Organisation that assigned the LOCAL PATIENT IDENTIFIER.
A code to identify the format and basis of the release of an NHS ORGANISATION CODE, in this case the ORGANISATION CODE of the PROVIDER which assigned the LOCAL PATIENT IDENTIFIER.
Business check: Stuff in red is not nesccary
RK 2: It is needed to explain it is org code type, rather than org code.

Description: An indication of whether Carer support is available to the PATIENT at their normal residence.
Business check: Why is this in CAP LOCKS?

Description: NHS NUMBER STATUS INDICATOR CODE is the trace status of the NHS NUMBER.

WITHHELD IDENTITY REASON is used in Data Group 'Withheld Identity Structure' in the Commissioning Data Sets (version 6-2 onwards).  It allows suppliers of Commissioning Data Set records to indicate to recipients of the record (for example, the Commissioner of the activity) that the record has been purposely anonymised for a valid reason.
Business check: Stuff in red doesn?t make sense

Description: The classification is phenotypical rather than genotypical, i.e. it does not provide codes for medical or scientific purposes.
This is used in the CDS to identify the format of a PATIENT NAME, with the classification values indicating whether it is a PERSON NAME STRUCTURED or PERSON NAME UNSTRUCTURED.

ORGANISATION CODE (RESIDENCE RESPONSIBILITY) is the ORGANISATION CODE according to the PATIENT's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS, where they reside within the boundary of a Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG).
ORGANISATION CODE (RESIDENCE RESPONSIBILITY) is the ORGANISATION CODE according to the PATIENT's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS, where they reside within the boundary of a Primary Care Trust (PCT).
The ORGANISATION TYPE of the ORGANISATION derived from the PATIENT's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS, where they reside within the boundary of a PRIMARY CARE TRUST (PCT).
The ethnicity of a PERSON, as specified by the PERSON.
A classification of OVERSEAS VISITOR STATUS at CDS Activity Date.
Data Dictionary Name: OVERSEAS VISITOR STATUS CLASSIFICATION AT CDS ACTIVITY DATE

Description: A code uniquely identifying a CONSULTANT.

CARE PROFESSIONAL MAIN SPECIALTY CODE is the specialty in which the CONSULTANT is contracted or recognised. MAIN SPECIALTY classifies clinical work divisions more precisely for a limited number of specialties.
TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE is recorded to report the specialised service within which the PATIENT is treated.
A unique identifier for a LOCAL SUB-SPECIALTY.

An indication of whether a PATIENT was seen by a single or multiple CARE PROFESSIONALS during a Clinic Attendance Consultant or Clinic Attendance Non-Consultant, recorded for the purposes of the National Tariff Payment System.
An indication of whether the CARE PROFESSIONAL TEAM undertaking a Rehabilitation Assessment, is specialised or non-specialised.
ATTENDANCE IDENTIFIER is the ACTIVITY IDENTIFIER for the attendance.
An indication of whether an APPOINTMENT for a CARE CONTACT took place.

An indication of whether a PATIENT is making a first attendance or contact; or a follow-up attendance or contact and whether the CONSULTATION MEDIUM USED national code was 'Face to face communication' or 'Telephone' or 'Telemedicine web camera'.
The type of CARE PROFESSIONAL staff dealing with the PATIENT during an Out-Patient Attendance Consultant or Nurse or Midwife Contact.
OPERATION STATUS CODES should be used once for each record to record states of knowledge regarding the operative procedure.
This records the outcome of an Out-Patient Attendance Consultant.
The date of an APPOINTMENT.
The time, recorded using the 24 hour clock, advised to a PATIENT for when they can expect to see a relevant CARE PROFESSIONAL at an Out-Patient Clinic.
EXPECTED DURATION OF APPOINTMENT is the expected duration in minutes of an APPOINTMENT when booked, prior to the attendance of the PATIENT.
CONSULTATION MEDIUM USED identifies the communication mechanism used to relay information between the CARE PROFESSIONAL and the PERSON who is the subject of the consultation, during a CARE ACTIVITY.
The type of waiting time measurement methodology which may be applied during a PATIENT PATHWAY.
EARLIEST CLINICALLY APPROPRIATE DATE is the earliest DATE that it was clinically appropriate for an ACTIVITY to take place.
Identifies the CLINIC OR FACILITY where an Out-Patient Appointment took place.

COMMISSIONING SERIAL NUMBER is the same as attribute NHS SERVICE AGREEMENT NUMBER (a number used to uniquely identify a NHS SERVICE AGREEMENT by an Organisation acting as commissioner of patient care services).
A number (alphanumeric) to provide a unique identifier for a line within a NHS SERVICE AGREEMENT.
PROVIDER REFERENCE NUMBER is a number convention agreed locally between a provider and Commissioner for use within a Commissioning Data Set message.
A number (alphanumeric) allocated by the commissioner to a REFERRAL REQUEST.
ORGANISATION CODE (CODE OF PROVIDER) is the ORGANISATION CODE of the Organisation acting as a Health Care Provider.
ORGANISATION CODE TYPE is a code to identify the format and basis of the release of an NHS ORGANISATION CODE being used.
ORGANISATION CODE (CODE OF COMMISSIONER) is the ORGANISATION CODE of the Organisation commissioning health care.
ORGANISATION CODE TYPE is a code to identify the format and basis of the release of an NHS ORGANISATION CODE being used.
LOCATION CLASS is a classification for use within Commissioning Data Set messages of the physical location within which the recorded PATIENT event occurs.
SITE CODE (OF TREATMENT) is the ORGANISATION SITE CODE of the Organisation where the PATIENT was treated, i.e. it should enable the treating Organisation to be identified.
GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTITIONER (SPECIFIED) is the GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTITIONER PPD CODE of the GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTITIONER specified by the PATIENT.
GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTICE CODE (PATIENT REGISTRATION) is the ORGANISATION CODE of the GP Practice that the PATIENT is registered with.
A code to identify the format and basis of the release of an NHS ORGANISATION CODE, in this case GP PRACTICE, being used.
The priority of a request for SERVICES; in the case of SERVICES to be provided by a CONSULTANT, it is as assessed by or on behalf of the CONSULTANT.
The terms of reference for the REFERRAL REQUEST.
The source of referral of each Consultant Out-Patient Episode.
The date the REFERRAL REQUEST was received by the Health Care Provider.
An indication of whether a PATIENT was referred to a Direct Access Service.
REFERRER CODE is the code of the PERSON making the REFERRAL REQUEST. This will normally be a CARE PROFESSIONAL, GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTITIONER or CONSULTANT.
REFERRING ORGANISATION CODE is the ORGANISATION CODE of the Organisation from which the referral is made, such as a GP Practice, NHS Trust or NHS Foundation Trust.
The ORGANISATION CODE TYPE of the ORGANISATION that referred the patient.

For the Elective Admission List Commissioning Data Set types, LAST DNA OR PATIENT CANCELLED DATE is derived from OFFERED FOR ADMISSION DATE and ADMISSION OFFER OUTCOME and is needed to meet central requirements. It is recorded when PATIENTS who have been offered a date for admission have missed this admission date with or without advance notice.
Data Dictionary Name: LAST DNA OR PATIENT CANCELLED DATE

Description: Developed by the National Casemix Office, Healthcare Resource Groups (HRGs) are standard groupings of clinically similar treatments which use common levels of healthcare resource.
Derivation_Methodology:
Please see NHS Digital's documentation for full details:
http://content.digital.nhs.uk/hrg
Business check: Not sure about links in the document. Copy and paste
RK 2: we thought about this but there is a LOT of information on this website, so wouldn't work too well on the portal. And it would be another source to monitor for updates

Description: The HRG version used for the record.
The type of CODED CLINICAL ENTRY used for the CLINICAL INTERVENTION.

The National Schedule of Reference Costs, developed by the Department of Health, uses Healthcare Resource Groups (HRGs) as the basis for costing in-patient and day case services. Healthcare Resource Groups (HRGs) are derived from existing CDS data items using an algorithm and a software package developed by the NHS Information Authority (Casemix Programme).
HRG DOMINANT GROUPING VARIABLE-PROCEDURES (DGVP) is a field derived by the HRG Acute Inpatient Grouper. It represents the procedure that the HRG grouping algorithm has identified as having the greatest effect upon the resources consumed by a PATIENT. It is required for the production of the National Schedule of Reference Costs reports.
Business check: Can we tone this down a little?

Description: The core HRG of the appointment, as determined by the HRG grouper.
The version of the HRG Grouper used.
The HRG code of the appointment as derived by NHS Digital prior to importing to the NCDR.
Business check: What's improting?  Also shouldn?t this be derived? Do we have access to NHSd's field of derivation?
RK 2: Typo, changed to 'importing'. Good spot. Also, NHS Digital derivation methodology is maintained by nhs digital. Only record ncdr derivations here to avoid duplication.

Description: The unique booking reference number assigned by the Choose and Book system when a PATIENT accepts an APPOINTMENT DATE OFFERED of an APPOINTMENT OFFER where the offer was made via the Choose and Book system.
An identifier, which together with the ORGANISATION CODE / ORGANISATION IDENTIFIER of the issuer, uniquely identifies a PATIENT PATHWAY.
ORGANISATION CODE (PATIENT PATHWAY IDENTIFIER ISSUER) is the ORGANISATION CODE of the Organisation issuing the PATIENT PATHWAY IDENTIFIER.
The status of an ACTIVITY (or anticipated ACTIVITY) for the REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD decided by the lead CARE PROFESSIONAL.
The start date of a REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD.
Data Dictionary Name: REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD START DATE

Description: The end date of a REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD.
Data Dictionary Name: REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD END DATE

Description: Not currently completed in the NCDR.
Business check: Why is this in there if that is the case?
RK 2: it's a weird one isnt it, but there is a flow in from NHS digital (which is all null) and an empty column in the table so best to include.

Description: AGE AT CDS ACTIVITY DATE is derived as the number of completed years between the PERSON BIRTH DATE of the PATIENT and the CDS ACTIVITY DATE.
The date of a change to a SERVICE PROVIDED UNDER AGREEMENT.

For Commissioning data, every CDS Type has a "CDS Originating Date" contained within the Commissioning Data Set data that must be used to populate the CDS ACTIVITY DATE. In this case, it is APPOINTMENT DATE.
EARLIEST REASONABLE OFFER DATE is the date of the earliest of the Reasonable Offers made to a PATIENT for an APPOINTMENT or Elective Admission.
The type of LOCATION for an ACTIVITY where: PATIENTS are seen, SERVICES are provided or from which requests for SERVICES are sent.
reflects the version number of the CDS XML Schema in use. Message version numbers are updated as required during the on-going message development processes.

Indicates how confidential a record is, can be null (not marked as confidential), '2' (Extremely sensitive - all personal confidential data items will be null), '3' (Sensitive - if personal confidential data is supplied by provider it is pseudonymised by NHS Digital) or '4' (Other sensitive - all personal confidential data will be set to null by NHS Digital).  Derived by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.
The Referral to Treatment length as derived by NHS Digital prior to importing to the NCDR.
Area code of the postcode of place of usual residence of the patient.  Derived by NHS Digital prior to importing to the NCDR.
Business check: Do we have access to NHS Digital derivation methodlogy?
RK 2: it is online, not included to avoid duplication/maintenance issues

Description: Indicates if the patient is an inpatient ('1') or an outpatient ('2').  In this table will always display '2'.
RK 2: This field is in both APC and OPA and distinguished between the two. As this is OP table, will always say outpatients. Understand now? I agree it is a weird field to include in a outpatients only table

Description: Derived prior to import to the NCDR. '1' means Admitted Patient Care, '2' means Elective Admission List, '3' means Attendance and '4' means A&E.  This table will always show only '3'.
Business check: Do we have access to NHS Digital derivation methodlogy?
RK 2: it is online, not included to avoid duplication/maintenance issues

Description: Indicates if the Appointment has been finished or not. Derived by SUS prior to importing to the NCDR. '1' means finished and null means unfinished.
Primary Care Trust in which the GP Practice is based. Derived by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.

The PRIMARY CARE TRUST is responsible for a population which comprises: those persons registered with GPs whose practices are within the PRIMARY CARE TRUST, irrespective of whether they reside within the boundary of the PRIMARY CARE TRUST, plus those persons who are not registered with any GP but who reside in the PRIMARY CARE TRUST's geographic area.
GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTICE CODE (PATIENT REGISTRATION) is the ORGANISATION CODE of the GP Practice that the PATIENT is registered with derived by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.

The PRIMARY CARE TRUST is responsible for a population which comprises: those persons registered with GPs whose practices are within the PRIMARY CARE TRUST, irrespective of whether they reside within the boundary of the PRIMARY CARE TRUST, plus those persons who are not registered with any GP but who reside in the PRIMARY CARE TRUST's geographic area.

The Strategic Health Authority in which the GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTICE CODE (PATIENT REGISTRATION) is based.
All Strategic Health Authorities closed 31 March 2013
Strategic Health Authority's responsibilities have been taken over by other Organisations.
A Strategic Health Authority is an NHS ORGANISATION established to lead the strategic development of the local health service and manage Primary Care Trusts (PCTs) and NHS Trusts on the basis of local accountability agreements.
Derived by BHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.
Business check: Abbreivate Primary Care Trust  -- it is abbreivated down below

Description: Defines the coding schema used for strategic health authority. 'P' means PDS, 'S' means 'SUS'.
The month that the PATIENT was born in, e.g. if the PATIENT was born in March, Month_of_Birth would be '3'.
The Electoral Ward of the ADDRESS nominated by the PATIENT with ADDRESS ASSOCIATION TYPE 'Main Permanent Residence' or 'Other Permanent Residence'. Derived by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.
the ORGANISATION CODE derived from the PATIENT's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS, where they reside within the boundary of a PRIMARY CARE TRUST.
The type of PCT derived from the postcode of the patient. Derived by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.

The ORGANISATION CODE derived from the PATIENT's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS, where they reside within the boundary of a Strategic Health Authority (SHA).
All Strategic Health Authorities closed 31 March 2013
Strategic Health Authority's responsibilities have been taken over by other Organisations.
A Strategic Health Authority is an NHS ORGANISATION established to lead the strategic development of the local health service and manage Primary Care Trusts and NHS Trusts on the basis of local accountability agreements.
Derived by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.
Defines the coding schema used for strategic health authority. 'P' means PDS, 'S' means 'SUS'.
Area code of the postcode of the provider.  Derived by NHS Digital prior to importing to the NCDR.
The year in which the patient was born, as derived by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.

The 2001 census output areas, built from unit postcodes and constrained to the 2003 statistical wards, which will form the building blocks for defining higher level geographies in the future. A pseudo code is included for the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.  Derived by NHS Digital prior to import to the NCDR.
A unique code representing a COUNTRY.
A County is a GEOGRAPHIC AREA.
Derivation_Methodology: Joins to the ODS postcode reference table on Patient Postcode and takes the county code.

Description: The code for the 1991 Census Enumeration District (ED).
An Electoral Division is a GEOGRAPHIC AREA frequently referred to as Wards.

The Electoral Ward is derived from the GEOGRAPHIC AREA CODE of GEOGRAPHIC AREA where GEOGRAPHIC AREA TYPE is 'Electoral Ward'. ADDRESS IN GEOGRAPHIC AREA provides the relationship between ADDRESS and GEOGRAPHIC AREA.
Government offices for the Regions (GOR) were built up of complete unitary authorities.  Have now been closed, as of 31st March 2011.
RK 2: I think it is useful to say what GOR stands for and what they are

Description:
A Unitary Authority (UA) is a GEOGRAPHIC AREA.
For further information on Unitary Authorities, see the Office for National Statistics (ONS) website at https://www.ons.gov.uk/census/2001censusandearlier/glossary/ou.

All Strategic Health Authorities closed 31 March 2013.
Strategic Health Authority's responsibilities have been taken over by other Organisations.
A Strategic Health Authority is an NHS ORGANISATION established to lead the strategic development of the local health service and manage Primary Care Trusts (PCTs) and NHS Trusts on the basis of local accountability agreements.
Business check: Do we need the length description?

Description: An Electoral Area is a GEOGRAPHIC AREA.

'Cleaned' provider code derived from the provider supplied value, formatted as 3 digits for NHS providers and 5 digits for IS / AWP providers i.e. 'RJE00' provider supplied value becomes 'RJE' - trailing '00' values removed.
Derivation_Methodology: In most cases, shortens the Provider Code to 3 digits (excluding site code).  Where Provider Code starts with ?N? or ?8?, the 5 character code is retained. If a provider submits provider codes such as RJE00, RJE01, RJE02 etc. in the Provider_Code field,  this field will store the value as RJE.
RK 2: good spot. Excel formatting thing, if you start a cell with ' then it formats the cell as text and doesn?t display the '

Description: 'Cleansed' provider site code derived from the provider supplied value/s, formatted to 5 digits for NHS / IS / AWP providers. Padded to 5 digits with '0' values for NHS providers where site cannot be derived (reference data also contains these unknown 'default' site values).
Derivation_Methodology: Where the first 3 characters of Site_Code_of_Treatment and Provider_Code are the same, Site_Code_of_Treatment is used.  If Provider_Code is 5 characters long, then this is used, and if Provider_Code is shorter than 5 characters, this is padded with zeros to make the field 5 characters long.
Business check: IWhy is Cleansed' s? Also is Padded really the right word to use?
RK 2: usual term used by data folk

Description: 'Cleansed' commissioner code derived from the provider supplied value, formatted as 3 except where provider supplied value begins with 'Y' (old SCG codes), when the first 5 characters are retained.
Derivation_Methodology: When Commissioner_Code starts with 'Y' then the  first 5 characters of Commissioner_Code are taken, otherwise the first three characters are taken.
Business check: Missing inverted comma. Why is there elipses at the end?

Description: Derived age using the Date_of_Birth and Appointment_Date fields.
Derivation_Methodology: Derived using the patient's date of birth and Appointment_Date.

Description: Derived activity month value based on Appointment_Date field in the format YYYYMM.
Derivation_Methodology: Takes the year and month values from the Appointment_Date.

Description: Derived financial year value based on Appointment_Date field in the format YYYY/YY.
Derivation_Methodology: The financial year that the Appointment_Date occurred in.
Business check: Does this need a forward slash?

Description: Count of the number of '***_Diagnosis_Code_[01-24] fields populated (i.e. not NULL) within the record.
Derivation_Methodology: Count of the total number of completed diagnosis fields for the appointment (Primary_Diagnosis_Code and Secondary_Diagnosis_Code_[1-23]).

Description: Count of the number of '***_Procedure_Code_[01-24] fields populated (i.e. not NULL) within the record.
Derivation_Methodology: Count of the total number of completed procedure fields for the appointment (Primary_Procedure_Code and Procedure_Code_[2-24]).

Description: A list of all the diagnosis codes for the attendance.
Derivation_Methodology: Concatenates all completed diagnosis codes (Primary_Diagnosis_Code and Secondary_Diagnosis_Code_[1-23]).
Business check: Is it going into too much detail to put  Excel detal? Concatenate meaning confusion

Description: A list of all the procedure codes contained in the attendance.
Derivation_Methodology: Concatenates all completed procedure codes (Der_Primary_Procedure_Code and Der_Procedure_Code_[2-24]).
Business check: Is it going into too much detail to put  Excel detal? Concatenate meaning confusion

Description: Differentiates between consultant and non-consultant led attendances.
Derivation_Methodology: When Main_Specialty_Code is one of '560', '900', '901', '902', '903', '904', '950' or '960' or is left null then set as 'Non-cons', in all other cases, set as 'Cons'.
Business check: Is it going into too much detail to put  Excel detal? Concatenate meaning confusion

Description: Differentiates between first and follow up attendances.
Derivation_Methodology: Derived from First_Attendance; where First_Attendance is '1' (First attendance face to face) or '3' (First telephone or telemedicine consultation) then 'New' is assigned.  When First_Attendance is '2' (Follow-up attendance face to face) or '4' (Follow-up telephone or telemedicine consultation) then 'FUp' is assigned, else it is set as 'N/A'.

Description: Differentiates between face to face and non face to face attendances.
Derivation_Methodology: Where FIRST ATTENDANCE is '1' (First attendance face to face) or '2' (Follow-up attendance face to face) then 'F2F' is assigned, where it is '3' (First telephone or telemedicine consultation) or '4' (Follow-up telephone or telemedicine consultation) it is 'NF2F'.  Anything else is given 'N/A'.

Description: Differentiates between single and multi professional attendances.
Derivation_Methodology: If any procedure code for the appointment contains 'X622' or 'X623' then it is assigned 'Multi', if not, it is assigned 'Single'.

Description: Differentiates between attended, non attended and cancellations.
Derivation_Methodology: When First_Attendance is '5' (Referral To Treatment Clock Stop Administrative Event), this takes priority and Der_Attendance_Type is 'Admin Event'.  Where this is not the case ATTENDED OR DID NOT ATTEND is used. '5' (Attended on time or, if late, before the relevant CARE PROFESSIONAL was ready to see the PATIENT) and '6' (Arrived late, after the relevant CARE PROFESSIONAL was ready to see the PATIENT, but was seen) map to 'Attend', '4' (APPOINTMENT cancelled or postponed by the Health Care Provider) maps to 'Cancel (Hos)', '2' (APPOINTMENT cancelled by, or on behalf of, the PATIENT) maps to 'Cancel (Pat)' and '7' (PATIENT arrived late and could not be seen) and '3' (Did not attend - no advance warning given) map to 'DNA'. '0' (Not applicable - APPOINTMENT occurs in the future) and any invalid values in the ATTENDED OR DID NOT ATTEND column are given 'Unk' (Unknown) in this column.

Description: Derived current CCG code based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the CCG where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, unless the given postcode is 'ZZ99 3VZ' (no fixed abode), 'ZZ99 3WZ' (address not known) or 'ZZ99 3CZ' (England UK - not specified), in which case null is given.

Description: Derived historic Primary Care Trust (PCT) code based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the Primary Care Trust (PCT) where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.  Uses the list of PCT geographies as of closure date (31st March 2013).
Business check: Shouldn?t this be in the description -- or in fact, in it at all?
RK 2: I think it should be left in yeah. Sorry!

Description: Derived postcode sector based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The Postcode Sector of the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.

Description: Derived grid eastings (100M) value based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The Easting Grid Reference where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.  Accurate to 100m when combined with Der_Postcode_Grid_Northing.

Description: Derived grid northing (100M) value based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The Northing Grid Reference where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.  Accurate to 100m when combined with Der_Postcode_Grid_Easting.

Description: Derived local authority code based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the Local Authority where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.

Description: Derived district unitary authority code based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the District Unitary Authority where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.

Description: Derived electoral ward code based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the Electoral Ward where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.

Description: Derived LSOA code based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the Lower Layer Super Output Area (LSOA) where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.  Uses the list of LSOAs as of the 2001 census.

Description: Derived MSOA (Middle Super Output Area) code based upon the Patient_Postcode field. Full list of MSOAs taken from NHS Digital's Organisation Data Service (ODS).
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the Middle Layer Super Output Area (MSOA) where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.  Uses the list of MSOAs as of the 2001 census.
Business check: is " Full list of MSOAs taken from ODS" relevant?

Description: Derived constituency code based upon the Patient_Postcode field.
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the constituency where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.

Description: Pseudonymised NHS Number value (12 digit numeric). Consistently applied within all 4 core datasets for cross linkage purposes.
Derivation_Methodology: Derived by Pseudonymising NHS number by applying Pseudonymisation algorithm.

Description: 2011 LSOA (Lower Layer Super Output Area) code derived from patient postcode. Full list of LSOAs taken from NHS Digital's Organisation Data Service (ODS).
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the Lower Layer Super Output Area (LSOA) where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.  Uses the list of LSOAs as of the 2011 census.
Business check: Should it not be "Full list of LSOAs taken from UKHD."?
RK 2: codes taken from ukhd which takes them from ods, so ods is original source. Just say ods for simplicity :)

Description: 2011 MSOA (Middle Layer Super Output Area) code derived from patient postcode. Full list of MSOAs taken from NHS Digital's Organisation Data Service (ODS).
Derivation_Methodology: The code of the Middle Layer Super Output Area (MSOA) where the patient's POSTCODE OF USUAL ADDRESS is based, derived by linking on postcode to a postcode geographies table.  Uses the list of MSOAs as of the 2011 census.
Business check: Should it not be "Full list of LSOAs taken from UKHD."?
RK 2: codes taken from ukhd which takes them from ods, so ods is original source. Just say ods for simplicity :)

Description: Differentiates between consultant and non-consultant led attendances following NHS Data Dictionary logic.
Derivation_Methodology: When Main_Specialty_Code is one of '560', '950' or '960' then set as 'Non-cons' (non-consultant), in all other cases, including nulls, set as 'Cons' (consultant).
Business check: Difference between the old definitions and the new. The one in the SUS has more information.
RK 2: old one included some derivation stuff, moved that to derivation methodology section so nothing lost

Description: The distance, in miles, between the postcode of the GP Practice of registration and the postcode of the Provider Site at which the healtcare activity took place.
Derivation_Methodology: Takes the northings and eastings from the centre point of the postcode of GP Practice of registration and the postcode of the Provider Site where the healthcare activity took place (where provider site is not available, uses main site) and uses MS SQL functions to calculate the distance, "as the crow flies". Inputs the UK projection of 27700 to ensure accurate results (a map projection is a systematic transformation of the latitudes and longitudes of locations from the surface of a sphere or an ellipsoid into locations on a plane).
Business check: Merge the two between the older one and the new one
RK 2: information held in old description but not new description is in the derivation methodology instead

Description: The distance, in miles, between the postcode of the patient's place of usual residence and the postcode of the Provider Site at which the healtcare activity took place.
Derivation_Methodology: Takes the northings and eastings from the centre point of the postcode of the patient's usual place of residence and the postcode of the Provider Site where the healthcare activity took place (where provider site is not available, uses main site) and uses MS SQL functions to calculate the distance, "as the crow flies".  Inputs the UK projection of 27700 to ensure accurate results (a map projection is a systematic transformation of the latitudes and longitudes of locations from the surface of a sphere or an ellipsoid into locations on a plane).
Business check: Merge the two between the older one and the new one
RK 2: information held in old description but not new description is in the derivation methodology instead

Inputs the UK projection of 27700 to ensure accurate results (a map projection is a systematic transformation of the latitudes and longitudes of locations from the surface of a sphere or an ellipsoid into locations on a plane).
